title: BBC Local Live: Coventry & Warwickshire on Tuesday 3 May 2016 - BBC News
summary: coventry city defender investigated over tweet .
renovation plans unveiled for stratford toll house .

documents.title: our coverage has ended
text: live updates for coventry and warwickshire have now ended .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: watch : latest weather for coventry and warwickshire
text: a dry night ahead with patchy cloud which will eventually melt away leaving clear spells in the early hours .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: jury sent out in tristram wallace murder trial
text: the jury in the murder trial of stratford man tristram wallace have retired to consider their verdict .
author: Stratford Herald

documents.title: coventry car fire
text: crews have been dealing with a car fire on coventry 's eastern bypass in binley this afternoon .
the vehicle was alight on the forecourt of the murco bp filling station .
author: Rosie Eaton
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: m69 : closed and slow traffic
text: the m69 is closed and there 's very slow traffic southbound between m1 j21 , leicester and j1 , a5 ( hinckley ) , because of a shed load and an accident involving two lorries and a car , bbc travel reports .
diversions are in operation .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: m6 : lane blocked and slow traffic
text: there 's a lane blocked and slow traffic on the m6 southbound at j3 , a444 ( nuneaton ) , because of an accident , bbc travel reports .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: awesome community effort for nuneaton world record attempt
text: nuneaton 's famed community spirit came out in full force for a world record attempt to raise funds for a charity so close to the town 's heart .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: latest : body found in rugby ; and former teacher admits sexual assault
text: these are some of our main stories today :
- police find man 's body in a tent in rugby
- former music teacher handed 12-month suspended sentence after admitting sexually assaulting a boy
- sky blues player investigated over homophobic tweet
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jimmy hill fund launched
text: coventry city players joined organisers for the launch of the jimmy hill legacy fund .
details of how to donate or raise money can be found here .
reice charles-cook takes part in a kick about @ twitterid as the # jimmyhill legacy fund is launched by @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Marian McNamee
Reporter, BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: warwick academics use photo site to track protest hotspots
text: academics from warwick business school have analysed data on 25 million photographs uploaded to the image hosting site flickr and produced a map of the world 's protests over a year .
after looking at images from 244 countries and regions they found that protests can be mapped across the world as they happen .
our findings underline the potential value of photographs posted on the internet as a source of global , cheap and rapidly available measurements of human behaviour around the world . ''

documents.title: former teacher sentenced for child sex offences
text: a former music teacher and church verger from leamington spa has been handed a 12-month suspended sentence after admitting sexually assaulting a boy .
alan baker , 80 , . from buckley road admitted two charges of sexual assault against a male under 18 and was sentenced at warwick crown court on friday .
the offences took place in september and october last year .
he 's also been ordered to sign the sex offenders register and was given a 10 year sexual harm prevention order .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: jlr workers heads to us for invictus games
text: colleagues from jaguar land rover have been giving co-worker james mcgill a big send off as he sets off to compete in the invictus games .
the former grenadier guard from rugby is heading to orlando where the games will start next week .
you can see my full report on midlands today on bbc one at 18:30 .
author: Ben Sidwell
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: body found in rugby
text: a man 's body has been discovered in a tent next to the river off newbold road in rugby , police say .
the death is not being treated as sus and police are asking for help identifying the body .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thousands turn out for rescued earlsdon festival
text: thousands of people enjoyed music , food and shopping at earlsdon festival in coventry yesterday .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: latest : footballer investigated over tweet ; police officer convicted over kidnap hoax
text: these are some of the stories making the headlines in the coventry newsroom today :
- sky blues footballer questioned over homophobic tweet
- west midlands police officer convicted over terrorist kidnap hoax
- jimmy hill legacy fund launched
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sats protest : parents to keep children off school
text: primary school children from across the west midlands could be kept off school today in a protest against new exams .
parents are supporting a campaign , which is trying to get the government to scrap the sats tests for six to seven year olds .
the department for education says the tests help teachers identify and provide the support pupils need , as well as giving parents a of how their child is doing .

documents.title: appeal to help find missing rugby man
text: people in rugby are being asked to help trace a man who went missing in brownsover on monday .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: hoax call claimed colleague would be kidnapped
text: hussain was involved in a hoax 999 call claiming a colleague would be kidnapped by a radical muslim with links to so-called islamic state , stafford crown court heard .
the police constable , 29 , was one of three men accused of conspiring to make a bogus call to west midlands police .
he had denied two counts of conspiracy to pervert the course of justice but was found guilty after a trial .

documents.title: breakingpolice officer convicted over terrorist kidnap hoax
text: west midlands police officer pc amar hussain , from birmingham , has been convicted of perverting the course of justice after making a hoax phone call claiming an officer was going to be kidnapped by terrorists .

documents.title: airport fault is rectified
text: passengers should see queues to get through security at birmingham airport start to improve as the it fault is rectified , the airport says .
birmingham airport
bhx official
the it fault we experienced in security has now been rectified and the time taken to proceed through security will now begin to improve .
the it fault we experienced in security has now been rectified and the time taken to proceed through security will now begin to improve .

documents.title: watch : latest weather for coventry and warwickshire
text: cloudier this afternoon , but still bright spells and the chance of occasional showers .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: manual security checks at birmingham airport : passengers 'leave extra time '
text: manual security checks were carried out at birmingham airport after a computer fault earlier .
passengers reported delays of 65 minutes at the security gate after a `` technical software issue '' .
a spokeswoman for the airport is advising passengers to leave extra time if travelling to the airport today but the fault has been repaired , and the queues are expected to improve .

documents.title: wasps ' jackson to join harlequins at end of season
text: wasps have confirmed fly-half ruaridh jackson will leave the club at the end of the season to join harlequins .
the scottish international has made 18 appearances for the club since joining ahead of the 2014/15 season .
we will part on good terms and wish him the very best at quins next season .
ruaridh is a great guy , who is extremely popular within the squad and is highly respected for his skill-set and his commitment to the team and to helping the squad succeed
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: renovation plans unveiled for stratford 's toll house
text: a £ 500,000 scheme to renovate the toll house on clopton bridge , in stratford-upon-avon , has been unveiled .
as well as preserving the fabric of the building , the stratford historic buildings trust wants to turn the 200-year-old house into offices .

documents.title: coventry city player apologises for 'completely unacceptable ' language
text: coventry city say they 're keen to stress an offensive remark tweeted by player , chris stokes , was `` completely unacceptable '' and wo n't happen again in future .
the club has launched an internal investigation into the player 's behaviour on social media and his use of the homophobic term .
they say the club will work with organisations such as kick it out and football v homophobia to help educate chris and the squad on why this language is unacceptable .

documents.title: jlr worker leaves for invictus games
text: jaguar land rover employee , james mcgill says it 's a `` great honour '' to be selected for the invictus games uk team .
the former grenadier guard from rugby is leaving for orlando today where he 'll compete in track and field events as well as swimming at the games next week .
he was medically discharged from the army after an explosive device was activated while he was serving in afghanistan .

the journey to selection has been tough , with so many great competitors in the mix , but the games has given so many former and serving men and women a renewed focus and set of goals which should never be underestimated .
author: Vic Minett
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: suspect arrested in coventry pub after manhunt
text: a man on the run from police in coventry was arrested in a city centre pub .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: your weather sunny southam
text: weather watcher 'old salt ' has posted this of blue skies in southam , recording a temperature of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: sky blues player investigated over apparent homophobic tweet
text: coventry city defender chris stokes is undergoing an internal investigation following claims he used a homophobic remark on twitter .
the 25-year-old used an apparent homophobic remark whilst commenting on the premier league match between chelsea and tottenham .
the tweet was quickly deleted and the player tweeted out an apology for the remark soon after .
in a statement he said : `` it was a brainless moment from me and i 'm really disappointed in myself for using that term , i 'm not homophobic at all '' .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: rugby to become 'hedgehog friendly '
text: a new hedgehog conservation area is being launched in rugby .
warwickshire wildlife trust is encouraging residents and businesses to help with mapping and monitoring the animals in a bid to halt decline .

documents.title: wasps ' edd shervington to retire for show business career
text: wasps hooker edd shervington is to seek a new career in show business when he retires at the end of the season .
at the age of 31 , the welsh chicken farmer , who runs a successful family free range egg business in gwent , is serious about fulfilling a genuine ambition to tread the boards .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest : jimmy hill fund launched ; toll house renovation plans ; and jlr worker leaves for invictus games
text: these are some of the stories making the headlines in coventry today :
- sky blues launch jimmy hill legacy fund
- plans to renovate stratford toll house revealed
- jlr worker leaves for orlando to compete in invictus games
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jimmy hill legacy fund launched
text: a new scheme set up to honour the late jimmy hill is to be launched today .

the legacy fund , named after the sky blues ' former manager and chairman , aims to help community groups , support disadvantaged youngsters and disabled people and make grants available to local charities .
it 'll be run by sky blues in the community .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: speeding driver jailed for four years after killing woman on pedestrian crossing in coventry
text: a speeding driver who knocked down and killed a young woman on a crossing in coventry has been jailed for four years .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: travel : a439 accident
text: there 's very slow traffic on the a439 in warwick road in ingon , at the ingon lane junction , because of an accident .
congestion is to black hill and the welcome road junction .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest : jimmy hill fund ; crowdfunding campaign for toddler with rare disease ; plans to renovate toll house
text: these are some of the stories we 're looking at today :
- sky blues launch jimmy hill legacy fund
- warwick family raise money for research into daughter 's rare condition
- scheme to renovate stratford toll house unveiled
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: baby tommy 'doing well ' after being born on m42 hard shoulder
text: the grandad of a baby boy born on the m42 in warwickshire at the weekend says the family 's nicknamed him `` j7 '' , as he was born near that junction .
tommy was delivered by his mum sam at the side of the motorway after they got stuck in traffic on saturday .
police went to help them .
terry kemp says baby tommy is doing well , despite being born three weeks early .

documents.title: watch : latest weather for coventry and warwickshire
text: after a fairly bright start with some sunny spells , scattered cloud will increase over the course of the day .
top temperatures of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : a45 accident
text: an accident is partially blocking the a45 london road , in stretton-on-dunsmore at stretton island .
congestion is back to to the rugby lane junction .
more details on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live
text: welcome to our live feed on tuesday morning , bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet @ twitterid message via facebook .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live
